title: Lie algebroid
summary: In mathematics, a Lie algebroid is a vector bundle A → M {\displaystyle A\rightarrow M} together with a Lie bracket on its space of sections Γ ( A ) {\displaystyle \Gamma (A)} and a vector bundle morphism ρ : A → T M {\displaystyle \rho :A\rightarrow TM} , satisfying a Leibniz rule. A Lie algebroid can thus be thought of as a "many-object generalisation" of a Lie algebra.
